intro: Corydalis staintonii, commonly known as the Stainton's Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple flowers. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It blooms in the spring and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
